    • Method Detail

      • convertToDataStructure

        public ArrayList<GIBBSLiteral> convertToDataStructure(ArrayList<Clause> clauses,
                                             Collection<Literal> evidence,
                                             ArrayList<String> startingPoints)
        We build a datastructure out of the ground clauses so that we can sample efficiently. Therefore, we create a list of literals where each literal is connected with its containing ground clause. If we now pick one of those literals, we know immediately, which ground clauses are affected if we swap the literal. We distinguish between soft, hard and cardinality (includes existential) clauses.
        Parameters:
        clauses -
        evidence -
        startingPoints - literals set to true initially (retrieved from MAP state)
        Returns:

      • sample

        public ArrayList<GIBBSLiteral> sample(int numberOfSamples,
                             ArrayList<Clause> clauses,
                             Collection<Literal> evidence,
                             ArrayList<String> startingPoints)
                               throws SQLException,
                                      SolveException,
                                      ParseException
        Gibbs sampling. Decides if to swap one axiom per sampling round. We do not swap the axiom if it violates any hard constraint (we then go to the next sampling round). We swap the axiom with probability: exp(sum w with swapped literal)/(exp(sum w with swapped literal)+exp(sum w without change) Only those clauses are included in the calculation which might change when swapping the selected litereal.
        Parameters:
        numberOfSamples - Number of literals we try to swap
        solver - Standard Solver
        Returns:
        Throws:
        SQLException
        SolveException
        ParseException
